companyInfo.name: AgriTech
companyInfo.slogan: Intelligent System for Agricultural Optimization in Dominican Republic

content.description: AgriTech represents an innovative solution that integrates artificial intelligence and real-time data analysis to transform Dominican agriculture. Our system addresses the structural and technological challenges that limit the efficiency, sustainability, and competitiveness of the national agricultural sector, offering accessible tools for small producers, students, and technology enthusiasts.

Agriculture in the Dominican Republic faces multiple challenges: insufficient use of traditional practices, limited incorporation of advanced technologies, and lack of access to data analysis tools. According to the FAO, digital technologies can increase agricultural productivity by 20-30%, but in the Dominican context these tools are applied in a limited way, especially among small producers.

Develop and implement an artificial intelligence-based platform that optimizes agricultural production through real-time data analysis, enabling improved efficiency and sustainability in the Dominican agricultural sector.

items.title: Integration of Advanced Technologies
items.description: Implement machine learning models and specialized sensors to collect and analyze data on soil, climate, and early detection of pests and diseases.

items.title: Optimization of Agricultural Resource Use
items.description: Reduce excessive use of fertilizers, water, and pesticides through personalized recommendations based on accurate data and predictive analysis.

items.title: Prevention of Pest and Disease Losses
items.description: Use artificial intelligence to identify and alert about potential threats to crops before they cause significant damage to production.

items.title: Accessibility for Different Types of Producers
items.description: Design an intuitive and adaptable system that can be used by small farmers, students, and technology enthusiasts in rural and urban areas.

items.title: Promotion of Agricultural Sustainability
items.description: Foster more responsible farming practices that minimize environmental impact and improve food security at the national level.

items.title: Non-Experimental Quantitative Approach
items.description: Descriptive and correlational research that analyzes the implementation of AI in agriculture without manipulating variables, observing the phenomenon in its natural context.

items.title: Real-Time Data Analysis
items.description: Continuous collection and processing of climate, soil, and crop information to generate immediate and accurate recommendations.

items.title: Validation with Real Users
items.description: Evaluation with a sample of 50-70 participants in the Cibao region, including farmers, agronomists, and institutional representatives.

items.title: Iterative Development
items.description: Continuous improvement process based on user feedback and results analysis to optimize the platform.

items.title: Precision Agriculture
items.description: Use of GPS technologies, sensors, and data analysis to optimize variable management of agricultural plots according to their specific characteristics.

items.title: Agriculture 4.0
items.description: Integration of Internet of Things (IoT), artificial intelligence, drones, and robotics for automated and precise management of production processes.

items.title: Complex Systems
items.description: Interdisciplinary approach that considers agriculture as a system where multiple variables converge: climate, soil, crops, and human factors.

items.title: Machine Learning
items.description: Application of algorithms that learn from historical data to predict weather conditions, identify pests, and recommend farming practices.

items.title: Digital Transformation of the Sector
items.description: Reduce the technological gap in the Dominican agricultural field, especially among small producers and rural communities.

items.title: Productivity Improvement
items.description: Expected 20-30% increase in agricultural productivity through resource optimization and data-driven decision making.

items.title: Environmental Sustainability
items.description: Reduction of environmental impact through efficient use of water, fertilizers, and pesticides, promoting responsible agricultural practices.

items.title: Social and Economic Development
items.description: Contribute to rural economic development, improve working conditions, and foster technological inclusion in agricultural areas.

items.title: Spatial Delimitation
items.description: Focused on the Cibao region, especially provinces like Monseñor Nouel and La Vega, recognized for their crop diversity and small producer activity.

items.title: Temporal Delimitation
items.description: Project development framed in the 2023-2025 period, allowing observation of substantial changes in productivity and decision-making processes.

items.title: Conceptual Delimitation
items.description: Specifically focused on precision agriculture with artificial intelligence, excluding genetic engineering, biotechnology, and machinery design.

items.title: Technical Limitations
items.description: System without direct integration with other agricultural platforms, focused on soil, climate, and pest analysis, not including financial or machinery management.

items.title: Dedication - Jeyllon Slon Sandoval Rosario
items.description: First, I dedicate this work to you, reader, for taking the time to read and analyze the work of my partner and me, who invested time and effort, and now you do the same. Thank you, Arcenio Sandoval, for being an exemplary father, the best of all, because you have taught me the difference between loving and wanting. Complicated decisions, uncertain future and wanting to be better, all are things that have crossed my mind, although I have always been clear about what I want to be and where to go. Thank you, María Rosario, for being a dedicated mother, because you have taught me why we should follow our objectives and goals. To my brother Arsenio Sandoval, who often teaches and prepares me, who never loses an argument, and to whom I wouldn't bring a glass of water, but I would give my heart if he needed it. Thank you for being my brother!
